title: What is the magical significance of "elementals" and sexual union in esoteric teachings?
first_phrase: In the last part of this text, the author continues to explore the topic of "elementaries" in magical teachings and their desire for immortality. This is in line with the Buddhist teaching that a "god" seeking liberation should pass through the human state of existence. The author also addresses the issue of determinism in nature and the need for one to distance oneself from the occult psyche of things to achieve a truly initiatic development. The text ends on a reference to Abraxa, a popular magical entity.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the attainment of supernatural dignity in humans empowers them not only to be free but also to liberate and become makers of gods. As one delves into the occult, it is crucial to distance oneself from the lower planes of existence and strive for integral initiatic development. The magical practice of sexual union is a dangerous but viable path to power, as explained in the secrets of our art.
